full_summary:
Wastewater Trash Cleanout Services
=====================================

### Solicitation Information

- ** solicitation number **: 51000-23-4119999
- ** publication date **: August 11, 2022
- ** tender closing date **: September 8, 2022, 4:00:00 PM
- ** contracting authority **: Amanda McCaig, 501 contracts@csc-scc.gc.ca, 306-659-9300

### Description of Requirement

The Correctional Service of Canada, Stony Mountain Institution, requires the services of a contractor to pump out the wastewater trash interceptor, kitchen grease interceptors, and holding tanks on their premises.

### Scope of Work

The following is a summary of the statement of work for this requirement:

* Pump out the wastewater trash interceptor, kitchen grease interceptors, and holding tanks at the Stony Mountain Institution
* Report any contraband observed entering the pumping equipment
* Report any deficiencies found to the project authority prior to leaving the premises
* Provide a written report describing the deficiencies within 24 hours to the project authority

### Expected Duration

The work is expected to be performed from April 1, 2023 to March 31, 2028.

### Trade Agreements

This procurement is subject to the following trade agreements:
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
* Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement

### Evaluation Criteria

Evaluation criteria and complete statement of work can be obtained by downloading the solicitation document and associated documents from Buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders.

### Important Notice

The Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada (English or French). After contract award, bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process.

### Procurement Assistance Canada

Procurement Assistance Canada (PAC) offers seminars to businesses interested in learning how to sell goods and services to the Government of Canada. The seminars are free and can be found on the Buyandsell.gc.ca website under Event Calendar.

 To download the solicitation document and associated documents, please visit: [Buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders](http://Buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders)

To learn more about purchasing with the Government of Canada, visit
